column5: Was out for a day of brookie fishing about a week and a half ago. Hit a lake north of the Soo by snowmobile. Biggest was a little over 20" and skinny...smaller fish were still a decent 16".  20"   18"   Since then Iv have just been sneaking out to some panfish and pike territory.  Lake Superior....Deep basin perch     Lake George... Weedbeds heating up!     St. Marys River   Steadily hitting pike on the tip-pups. This next month should heat up and the big girls should start to steadily roll in. Ive only seen one 36-40" fish hooked so far this season, only to be lost in the hole....      Even stopped by the locks one afternoon for some downtown whitie action!    I hope to report back next with some nice pike results....Maybe even a trip to LSPP!  TDunn
Nice mish mash of fish. Those specks are gorgious.  I was talking to a guy this week about Superior perch...says guys are catching huge ones.
Just a quicky - that's what I tell my wife!  Nice reports, well done.
Is that all you got?   Phhhhh.  I love those brookies man.
Nice mix bag o fish TDunn Love the colors on those specks Thanks for sharing Leechman
YUMMM Specks ! I need a trip North bad! Just not sure I have any takers for the trail in anymore! lol  Some nice pics of fishies there Tyler!!
I'd be happy with any one of those fishies.
Wayne if you are ever lookin for company in search of specks .. I am but one PM away !!!!
sweet buddy! we've managed a few ourselves... big trip this weekend!
Now if I could just get my work to move up to the Soo
Your killing me!!!!  :wallbash: Nice fish!!! R
